[vc_row type=”full_width_background” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#1b203e” bg_image=”6281″ bg_position=”center top” background_image_loading=”default” bg_repeat=”no-repeat” scene_position=”center” top_padding=”7%” bottom_padding=”10″ translate_y=”0″ text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overflow=”visible” id=”services” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” top_margin=”5%” bottom_margin=”5%” column_element_direction_desktop=”default” column_element_spacing=”default” desktop_text_alignment=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” background_color=”#ffffff” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_backdrop_filter=”none” column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” column_position=”default” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”2/3″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” animation_type=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Black Men Business Talks” font_container=”tag:h2|font_size:44|text_align:left|color:%23000000|line_height:50px” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1735815626109{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]

Tuesday 14th October

6pm – 9.30pm

[/vc_column_text][vc_video link=”https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gwdToH75WOM” css=””][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1754921861007{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]

Black Men Business Talks creates a powerful platform for Black Men to master the art of influential leadership and strategic business growth. This event brings together visionary entrepreneurs, senior executives, and industry innovators who are redefining success on their own terms.

Through candid conversations, intimate panel discussions, and high-value networking, attendees will discover how to leverage their unique perspectives as competitive advantages, break through traditional barriers, and build businesses and careers with lasting impact.

This event is a moment for Black men to step into their power and join a community of ambitious leaders. Whether you’re positioning yourself for senior leadership, scaling a transformative business, or ready to make a big change, this is the room for you.

Key themes:
1. Master the art of authentic leadership to ensure your voice is heard in every room
2. Step into your power to lead and influence teams, even when facing challenging dynamics or navigating difficult markets
3. Transform your entrepreneurial visions into scalable businesses that create lasting impact
4. Know when to make a bold move by finding the balance between mastering your craft and seizing stretch opportunities
5. Build pathways for the next generation by creating meaningful change in your workplace, business, and beyond

bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Vusi Thembekwayo

World-Renowned Entrepreneur & Investor[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Vusi Thembekwayo is a world-renowned entrepreneur, investor, and global keynote speaker celebrated as the “rockstar of public speaking.” He has delivered over 480 keynotes across six continents, from the Oxford Union and Harvard’s Centre for African Studies to sold-out arenas in New York, London, Dubai, Lagos, and Johannesburg. Along the way, he has shared the stage with Oprah Winfrey, T.D. Jakes, Sir Bob Geldof, and debated some of the brightest minds in history—crushing a famous Oxford Union debate by 273 votes to 28. Named among the Top 12 speakers in the world, his thought leadership continues to shape industries and inspire audiences worldwide.

Beyond his commanding presence on stage, Vusi is Executive Chairman of Thembekwayo Legacy Group and founder of MyGrowthFund Venture Partners, a platform committed to backing 100 businesses and creating 100,000 jobs across Africa. By 28, he was a Dragon investor on Dragon’s Den Africa and a board director of a JSE-listed company; by 29, he had graced the cover of Entrepreneur magazine. He is the author of bestsellers The Magna Carta of Exponentiality and Business & Life Lessons from a Black Dragon, which together have sold over a million copies, and his podcast Ideas That Matter ranks among South Africa’s top 10. His accolades include the Toastmasters International Communication & Leadership Award (2025), African Achievers Award (2024), Paul Harris Fellowship (2024), GQ Business Leader of the Year (2019), and Best Impact Investor in Africa (2020). A force of nature in both business and thought leadership, Vusi doesn’t just speak about change—he builds it.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ text_direction=”default”]

Amani Simpson

Award-Winning Youth Coach, Filmmaker and Social Entrepreneur[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]AMANI SIMPSON is an award-winning youth coach, social impact filmmaker, and visionary entrepreneur committed to empowering current and future generations to rise above adversity. Inspired by his own powerful journey of transformation, he founded the social enterprise AVIARD to instil hope and resilience in young people through personal development, digital media, and meaningful opportunities. Amani seamlessly blends creativity with deep expertise in youth engagement to challenge perspectives, uplift communities, and enrich lives.

He is best known as the producer and protagonist of the acclaimed short film AMANI, starring Hollywood actor Joivan Wade, which garnered over one million views within just four days of release. Amani also serves as patron of The AMANI Project, a six-month mentoring programme for at-risk young Londoners, launched in 2020 in partnership with Goldman Sachs, Hogan Lovells, and Mentivity.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Mahari Hay

CEO & Co-Founder, The CCC Group[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Mahari Hay is a visionary leader, community builder, and connector of people and ideas. With over 20 years of experience in finance and leadership roles, Mahari has built a reputation for driving transformation, championing diversity, and empowering others to lead with purpose.

As the CEO and Co-Founder of the Community, Corporate & Culture Group, Mahari is committed to creating spaces where businesses and communities can collaborate to deliver meaningful change.

A proud Freeman of the City of London and an award-winning Finance Sector Director, Mahari blends deep industry expertise with a passion for social impact. His work sits at the crossroads of corporate leadership and grassroots community building — inspiring audiences to think bigger, act bolder, and lead inclusively.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Mike Williams

Co-founder and Director Flake Bake[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Mike Williams is the proud co-founder of Flake Bake Ltd, the UK’s largest producer of authentic handmade Jamaican patties. With an undergraduate degree in Economics and Politics and an MSc in Business from Warwick University, Mike partnered with his father, Paul, to establish their bakery in Peckham.

Under Mike’s leadership, Flake Bake has achieved remarkable milestones, including winning Channel 4’s Aldi’s Next Big Thing in 2024. This success led to the company selling over 190,000 Jamaican Beef Patties in its first three Special Buys. Today, Flake Bake sells over a million handmade patties annually while also holding a multimillion-pound contract with Aldi, supplying their award-winning Jamaican Beef and Chicken Patties nationwide.

Mike’s entrepreneurial journey has garnered widespread media attention, with features in The Grocer and The Independent, alongside appearances on ITV News, Channel 4 News, BBC London News, and BBC Radio 4 and 5. His achievements have earned him recognition as one of HSBC’s Top 25 Black Entrepreneurs for 2024 and Entrepreneur Rising Star 2024 at the UK Black British Business Awards.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” text_direction=”default”]

Marvyn Harrison

Founder, Dope Black Dads & BELOVD Agency[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Marvyn Harrison is a visionary leader who has become renowned for his ability to deliver business goals and drive cultural change through sound strategy, communication, and people management.

As the founder of Dope Black Dads and Dope Black Men, Marvyn has become a powerful voice for the Black community across the UK, US, and Africa. Through his work at BELOVD, a strategic consultancy focusing on cultural transformation, he has helped clients such as WPP, Footlocker, City Football Group, and News UK achieve tangible results across a range of projects and campaigns. By focusing on policies and procedures, talent acquisition, HR, and people strategy, Marvyn is able to effect real change and deliver meaningful results.

In addition to his impactful work, Marvyn is a regular contributor to Good Morning Britain, Steph’s Packed Lunch, The Kick Off, and BBC 5Live, and is an accomplished author, having published two children’s books with Pan Macmillan Kids.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” Clement Ogbonnaya

CEO, The Village People[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Clement, an entrepreneur based in South London, is the founder of two pubs: Prince of Peckham and Queen of the South in Tulse Hill. Clement came to the UK from Nigeria when he was just six years old, was raised in Peckham and attended a school just a 10-minute walk away from the pub that he now owns.

A love for his area and an interest in people inspired Clement’s venture into hospitality. Keeping the community at the forefront of everything he does, he opened his first pub, Prince of Peckham, to be a ‘solution to gentrification’, aiming to create a space for all to come and enjoy quality food and drink.

In 2022, Clement founded The Village People pub group to educate the community on local issues and challenges, as well as highlighting ways to make a positive difference. Clement has plans to open a new pub every year for the next five years to help give different communities around London a place to meet, socialise and feel welcome, particularly marginalised, and underrepresented communities.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” Emmanuel Adenitire

MD, Global Banking & Markets Engineering, Goldman Sachs[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Emmanuel Adenitire is a seasoned Managing Director at Goldman Sachs, focusing on Global Markets Engineering. With a robust background in computer systems design and extensive experience within the financial sector, Emmanuel has held pivotal roles, including at Barclays Investment Bank, before advancing to lead critical systems engineering and innovation at Goldman Sachs in London. Growing up in Africa and studying across Europe, he brings a truly international perspective to his work. Known for his meticulous attention to detail, collaborative leadership style, and commitment to delivering high-quality results, Emmanuel excels in driving technology-driven solutions within complex environments. He actively participates in industry initiatives and diversity advocacy, including serving as a founding member of Black Rise and as a judge for prominent digital innovation awards.

Uche Onuma

Managing Director, IBM[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

As a Managing Director and Vice President at IBM, Uche leads the strategic partnership with Lloyds Banking Group. He is a member of IBM’s UK & Ireland leadership team, responsible for driving growth, delivery excellence, and client impact across one of the company’s most significant financial services relationships.

With over 20 years’ experience in the technology sector, Uche has held senior leadership roles at IBM, Google, and Dell. His career spans enterprise sales, outsourcing, channel strategy, P&L ownership, and delivery across global enterprises, mid-sized firms, and start-ups.

He is a committed advocate for diversity, equity, and inclusion. At IBM, he is the Co-Executive sponsor of the UKI Black Business Resource Group and a member of the UK&I Inclusion Council.

Kevin Millwood

Head of Information Security, Hargreaves Lansdown[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Kevin is Head of Information Security at Hargreaves Lansdown, the UK’s largest investment platform. With over 15 years experience in IT and Security, he has a proven track record of delivering effective and innovative solutions to protect the data and assets of clients and stakeholders.

Kevin serves as the Chairperson of the Board for LSC, a social enterprise providing Sports facilities for Bristol schools and the local community, and also sits on the Board for The Bristol Reggae Orchestra and Windrush Choir, a multicultural and diverse organisation that celebrates the reggae genre and its cultural heritage. He previously chaired for Babbasa, a youth empowerment charity helping young people from disadvantaged backgrounds pursue professional aspirations.

Richie Brave

Presenter, Broadcaster, Writer & Host, BBC 1Xtra[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Richie Brave is a Presenter, Broadcaster & Writer hailing from South London. He is known for his hard-hitting interviews and honest social criticism, which challenges people to think and reflect on themselves. Aside from his media experience, he has amassed over a decade’s worth of work in the community and uses this to shape and create engaging dialogue and interviews. Richie is host of BBC 1Xtra’s “1Xtra Talks” exploring the lived experiences of Black people across the UK. 

Richie has interviewed the likes of Whoopi Goldberg, Ryan Coogler, Angela Bassett, HER, Master P, Mr Eazi, Wale and many others. Through 2018/19 he regularly co-hosted the Sunday Morning show with Penny Smith on Talk Radio, exploring the tabloids, politics and debating current affairs. This versatility speaks to his ability to engage anyone.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner Elfried Samba

Co-Founder & CEO, Butterfly Effect[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Elfried Samba is the Co-Founder and CEO of Butterfly Effect, a marketing agency helping brands grow through community-driven marketing, culture, and creativity.

As Global Head of Social Content at Gymshark, he helped scale the brand’s fitness community from 1.5 million to over 20 million followers, contributing to its rise to a £1 billion valuation alongside giants like Nike and Lululemon.

In its breakout year, Butterfly Effect partnered with Netflix, Bumble, McDonald’s, and Square, establishing itself as a go-to agency for culturally relevant, community-led campaigns.

Over the past five years, Elfried’s personal LinkedIn has become the second most engaged account on LinkedIn (Globally), generating 500M+ impressions, 9M+ engagements, and 370K+ followers – setting a new benchmark for personal brand-led growth on the platform.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit”
